meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tentative.
meanings.sent1: Her tentativeness in making decisions often led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent2: I could sense the tentativeness in his voice as he asked for my opinion.
meanings.sent3: The tentativeness of the squirrel as it approached the bird feeder was comical.
meanings.sent4: The tentativeness of the first snowflake to touch the ground was like a delicate dance.
meanings.sent5: The tentativeness of the new student in class was palpable to everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of being hesitant or uncertain.
meanings.sent1: His tentativeness in accepting the job offer was evident in his body language.
meanings.sent2: The team's tentativeness in making a decision caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The tentativeness of the cat as it approached the water bowl was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The tentativeness of the sun peeking through the clouds created a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The tentativeness of the child trying to ride a bike for the first time was endearing.
